sourceMeaningMnemonic: On the <radical>roof</radical> there's some type of <radical>turkey</radical> <radical>bird</radical>, but thinner and longer. You look closer and realize it's a <kanji>crane</kanji>.
meaningInfo: Picture the beautiful black and white crane dancing gracefully on the roof. Now that you know what it is, you feel a little bad about calling it a turkey bird.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>crane</kanji> leans down toward you from its roof perch and squawks, "<reading>Too ru</reading>de (<ja>つる</ja>)!" You're shocked! You didn't know the crane could speak English, but even worse, it knew you called it a turkey bird.
readingInfo: The crane keeps saying you're too rude whenever other people come close so they know what kind of person you are. Yikes, you really shouldn't have gotten on this crane's bad side.
